thread.title: Palace beats West Brom 2-0 to move 3rd in Premier League
thread.title_full: Palace beats West Brom 2-0 to move 3rd in Premier League

title: Palace beats West Brom 2-0 to move 3rd in Premier League
text:
Crystal Palace beats West Brom 2-0 to move provisionally 3rd in Premier League THE ASSOCIATED PRESS   9:44   9:44   
People: 
United Kingdom (463) 

LONDON â€” Crystal Palace moved provisionally third in the Premier League on Saturday with a dominant 2-0 win over West Bromwich Albion, which fell to its first away defeat of the season. 
Palace, which had a strong penalty appeal turned down minutes earlier, broke the deadlock in the 68th minute as West Brom failed to clear a corner and it came out to Yohan Cabaye, who put in an inch-perfect cross for an unmarked Yannick Bolasie to head home. It was his first goal at Selhurst Park in almost three years. 
Cabaye secured the result with a penalty after Chris Brunt brought down Wilfried Zaha, who had tormented West Brom's defense all match. 
West Brom had an early blow when Jonny Evans limped off with a hamstring injury in the 24th.
